>  Follow service.



<h3 id="add">Add</h3>

>  Add follow.



* HTTP Gateway

	* URL: `/relation/follow/account/{target}`
	* Method: `POST`
	* Content-Type: `application/json`

* Request Type: ***ApplyRequest***

>  Relation apply request.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|target|int64|string| Target ID, e.g. group ID, account ID or channel ID|-|true|
|reason|string|string| Action reason|-|false|




> JSON Demo

```json
{
  "target": "string($int64)",
  "reason": "string"
}
```



* Response Type: ***Empty***

>  A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated
>  empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request
>  or the response type of an API method. For instance:
> 
>      service Foo {
>        rpc Bar(google.protobuf.Empty) returns (google.protobuf.Empty);
>      }
> 
>  The JSON representation for `Empty` is empty JSON object `{}`.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|

<h3 id="getfollowers">GetFollowers</h3>

>  Get account followers.



* HTTP Gateway

	* URL: `/relation/follow/followers/{target.id}`
	* Method: `GET`


* Request Type: ***PaginationIdRequest***

>  Pagination ID request.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|target|[UniqueId](#uniqueid)|object| Target ID|-|false|
|offset|int64|string| Offset number|-|true|
|count|int|number/string| Count|-|true|






* Response Type: ***PaginationIdResponse***

>  Pagination ID response.

|Field|proto type|JSON type|Comment|Default|Required|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|more|bool|true, false| If has more records|-|true|
|next|int64|string| Offset number for next request|-|true|
|data|[UniqueIds](#uniqueids)|object| Response data|-|true|



> JSON Demo

```json
{
  "more": true,
  "next": "string($int64)",
  "data": {
    "ids": [
      "string($int64)"
    ]
  }
}
```
